abstract: The current position of the switch.
overview:
## Discussion

The values [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/StateValue/off] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/StateValue/on] indicate that the switch is in the off or on position. The switch treats any value other than [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/StateValue/off] as on.

Setting this property through the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimatablePropertyContainer/animator()] proxy animates the switch to the new value.

# state

**Instance Property**

The current position of the switch.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var state: NSControl.StateValue { get set }
```

## Discussion

The values [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/StateValue/off] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/StateValue/on] indicate that the switch is in the off or on position. The switch treats any value other than [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/StateValue/off] as on.

Setting this property through the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimatablePropertyContainer/animator()] proxy animates the switch to the new value.
title: state
